doc.title: EMBOSS

description.text: European Molecular Biology Open Software Suite

doc.reference: EMBOSS: The European Molecular Biology Open Software Suite (2000) Rice,P. Longden,I. and Bleasby, A. Trends in Genetics 16, (6) pp276--277

description.text: Draw a sequence alignment with pretty formatting

fieldset.title: This parameter is mandatory
fieldset.data-formats: FASTA MSF PAIR MARKX0 MARKX1 MARKX2 MARKX3 MARKX10 SRS SRSPAIR SCORE UNKNOWN MULTIPLE SIMPLE MATCH

xhtml:div.label:
Matrix file?
Eblosum30 Eblosum35 Eblosum40 Eblosum45 Eblosum50 Eblosum55 Eblosum60 Eblosum62 Eblosum62-12 Eblosum65 Eblosum70 Eblosum75 Eblosum80 Eblosum85 Eblosum90 Eblosumn Ednafull Ednamat Ednasimple Epam10 Epam100 Epam110 Epam120 Epam130 Epam140 Epam150 Epam160 Epam170 Epam180 Epam190 Epam20 Epam200 Epam210 Epam220 Epam230 Epam240 Epam250 Epam260 Epam270 Epam280 Epam290 Epam30 Epam300 Epam310 Epam320 Epam330 Epam340 Epam350 Epam360 Epam370 Epam380 Epam390 Epam40 Epam400 Epam410 Epam420 Epam430 Epam440 Epam450 Epam460 Epam470 Epam480 Epam490 Epam50 Epam500 Epam60 Epam70 Epam80 Epam90 Sssub
This is the scoring matrix file used when comparing sequences. By default it is the file 'EBLOSUM62' (for proteins) or the file 'EDNAFULL' (for nucleic sequences). These files are found in the 'data' directory of the EMBOSS installation.

Number of residues to be displayed on each line?
The number of residues to be displayed on each line

Residues before a space (value greater than or equal to 1)?
Same as -residuesperline to give no breaks
Colour residues by their consensus value. Yes No
Colour to display identical residues (red)
Colour to display similar residues (green)
Colour to display other residues (black)
Colour residues by table oily, amide etc. Yes No

Shading?
Set to BPLW for normal shading (black, pale, light, white) so for pair = 1.5,1.0,0.5 and shade = BPLW Residues score Colour 1.5 or over... BLACK (B) 1.0 to 1.5 ... BROWN (P) 0.5 to 1.0 ... WHEAT (L) under 0.5 .... WHITE (W) The only four letters allowed are BPLW, in any order.
Values to represent identical similar related (value greater than or equal to 0.0)
Only match those which are identical in all sequences. (value greater than or equal to 0)
Display prettyboxes Yes No
Colour the background in the boxes Yes No
Colour to be used for background. (grey)
Display the sequence names Yes No
Margin size for the sequence name.
Display the residue number Yes No
Display the date and options used Yes No

Plurality check value (totweight/2)?
Half the total sequence weighting
Display the consensus Yes No
Allow collisions in calculating consensus Yes No

Use alternative collisions routine?
Normal collision check. (default) Compares identical scores with the max score found. so if any other residue matches the identical score then a collision has occurred. If another residue has a greater than or equal to matching score and these do not match then a collision has occurred. Checks all those not in the current consensus.if any of these give a top score for matching or identical scores then a collision has occured.
Values are 0:Normal collision check. (default) 1:Compares identical scores with the max score found. So if any other residue matches the identical score then a collision has occurred. 2:If another residue has a greater than or equal to matching score and these do not match then a collision has occurred. 3:Checks all those not in the current consensus.If any of these give a top score for matching or identical scores then a collision has occured.
Print residue scores
Set page to portrait Yes No
Choose the e_graph output format Png Gif Cps Ps Meta Data
Name of the output graph

div.title: This parameter is mandatory
div.data-formats: FASTA MSF PAIR MARKX0 MARKX1 MARKX2 MARKX3 MARKX10 SRS SRSPAIR SCORE UNKNOWN MULTIPLE SIMPLE MATCH

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: This is the scoring matrix file used when comparing sequences. By default it is the file 'EBLOSUM62' (for proteins) or the file 'EDNAFULL' (for nucleic sequences). These files are found in the 'data' directory of the EMBOSS installation.
The number of residues to be displayed on each line
Same as -residuesperline to give no breaks

Set to BPLW for normal shading (black, pale, light, white) so for pair = 1.5,1.0,0.5 and shade = BPLW Residues score Colour 1.5 or over... BLACK (B) 1.0 to 1.5 ... BROWN (P) 0.5 to 1.0 ... WHEAT (L) under 0.5 .... WHITE (W) The only four letters allowed are BPLW, in any order.

Values are 0:Normal collision check. (default) 1:Compares identical scores with the max score found. So if any other residue matches the identical score then a collision has occurred. 2:If another residue has a greater than or equal to matching score and these do not match then a collision has occurred. 3:Checks all those not in the current consensus.If any of these give a top score for matching or identical scores then a collision has occured.

div.title: This parameter is mandatory
div.data-formats: FASTA MSF PAIR MARKX0 MARKX1 MARKX2 MARKX3 MARKX10 SRS SRSPAIR SCORE UNKNOWN MULTIPLE SIMPLE MATCH

format.code: ("", " -matrixfile=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

comment.text: This is the scoring matrix file used when comparing sequences. By default it is the file 'EBLOSUM62' (for proteins) or the file 'EDNAFULL' (for nucleic sequences). These files are found in the 'data' directory of the EMBOSS installation.

This is the scoring matrix file used when comparing sequences. By default it is the file 'EBLOSUM62' (for proteins) or the file 'EDNAFULL' (for nucleic sequences). These files are found in the 'data' directory of the EMBOSS installation.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: This is the scoring matrix file used when comparing sequences. By default it is the file 'EBLOSUM62' (for proteins) or the file 'EDNAFULL' (for nucleic sequences). These files are found in the 'data' directory of the EMBOSS installation.

interface.label: Colour residues by table oily, amide etc. Yes No

comment.text: Set to BPLW for normal shading (black, pale, light, white) so for pair = 1.5,1.0,0.5 and shade = BPLW Residues score Colour 1.5 or over... BLACK (B) 1.0 to 1.5 ... BROWN (P) 0.5 to 1.0 ... WHEAT (L) under 0.5 .... WHITE (W) The only four letters allowed are BPLW, in any order.

interface.label:
Shading?
Set to BPLW for normal shading (black, pale, light, white) so for pair = 1.5,1.0,0.5 and shade = BPLW Residues score Colour 1.5 or over... BLACK (B) 1.0 to 1.5 ... BROWN (P) 0.5 to 1.0 ... WHEAT (L) under 0.5 .... WHITE (W) The only four letters allowed are BPLW, in any order.

3 values separated by commas or spaces are required

velem.label: Compares identical scores with the max score found. so if any other residue matches the identical score then a collision has occurred.
If another residue has a greater than or equal to matching score and these do not match then a collision has occurred.
Checks all those not in the current consensus.if any of these give a top score for matching or identical scores then a collision has occured.

format.code: ("", " -alternative=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

comment.text: Values are 0:Normal collision check. (default) 1:Compares identical scores with the max score found. So if any other residue matches the identical score then a collision has occurred. 2:If another residue has a greater than or equal to matching score and these do not match then a collision has occurred. 3:Checks all those not in the current consensus.If any of these give a top score for matching or identical scores then a collision has occured.

interface.label:
Use alternative collisions routine?
Normal collision check. (default) Compares identical scores with the max score found. so if any other residue matches the identical score then a collision has occurred. If another residue has a greater than or equal to matching score and these do not match then a collision has occurred. Checks all those not in the current consensus.if any of these give a top score for matching or identical scores then a collision has occured.
Values are 0:Normal collision check. (default) 1:Compares identical scores with the max score found. So if any other residue matches the identical score then a collision has occurred. 2:If another residue has a greater than or equal to matching score and these do not match then a collision has occurred. 3:Checks all those not in the current consensus.If any of these give a top score for matching or identical scores then a collision has occured.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: Values are 0:Normal collision check. (default) 1:Compares identical scores with the max score found. So if any other residue matches the identical score then a collision has occurred. 2:If another residue has a greater than or equal to matching score and these do not match then a collision has occurred. 3:Checks all those not in the current consensus.If any of these give a top score for matching or identical scores then a collision has occured.

format.code: ("", " -showscore=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]
